input.description:
wsdl location [Optional]
The target WSDL URL for Amazon EC2. The value of this parameter overrides the WSDL URL value provided in adapter configuration. A sample WSDL URL is - http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2009-11-30/AmazonEC2.wsdl

endpoint address [Optional]
The WebService endpoint to use for performing operations on Amazon EC2 instances across different regions. Respective values for different regions are as below:
* http://us-east-1.ec2.amazonaws.com/ — Endpoint located in the US-East (Northern Virginia) Region * http://us-west-1.ec2.amazonaws.com/ — Endpoint located in the US-West (Northern California) Region * http://eu-west-1.ec2.amazonaws.com/ ---Endpoint located in the EU (Ireland) Region

session token [Optional] : The AWS session token which is generally created for temporary access to users for role based authorization.
Please Note: The temporary access key , secret key and session token to be generated by the user to provide in adapter request.
Please refer below AWS docs for more details
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_temp_request.html
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/sts/assume-role.html
region [Optional] The region to communicate with.

image id [Mandatory]
The AMI ID whose attribute is to be modified.

launch permission [Optional]
Adds/removes the specified AWS account ID/group to the list of launch permissions for the AMI.
add - Adds permission remove - Remove permission user-id - AWS Account ID group - Name of the group. Currently supports "all"
Sample Structure:
<launch-permission> <!--You have a CHOICE of the next 2 items at this level--> <add> <!--Zero or more repetition --> <item> <user-id></user-id> </item> <item> <group></group> </item> </add>
<remove> <!--Zero or more repetition --> <item> <user-id></user-id> </item> </remove>
</launch-permission>

product codes [Optional]
Product code set to add to the AMI. After you add a product code to an AMI, it can't be removed.
<product-codes> <!--Zero or more repetition --> <item> <product-code>?</product-code> </item> </product-codes>

description [Optional]
The description of the AMI.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <amazon-ec2-rest-request> <xsl:if test="string-length('${access key}')>0"> <access-key>${access key}</access-key> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${secret key}')>0"> <secret-key>${secret key}</secret-key> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${session token}')>0 and string-length('${secret key}')>0 and string-length('${access key}')>0"> <session-token>${session token}</session-token> </xsl:if> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">modify-image-attribute</xsl:text> </operation-name> <xsl:if test="string-length('${region}')>0"> <region>${region}</region> </xsl:if> <parameters> <image-id>${image id}</image-id> ${launch permission}${product codes} <xsl:if test="string-length('${description}')>0"> <description> <value>${description}</value> </description> </xsl:if> </parameters> </amazon-ec2-rest-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Modifies an attribute of an AMI.
